result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Noah L Zachman

records.addlTxt:
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:16 PM Defendant Noah L Zachman in court, in custody.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Noah L Zachman.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, the court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/Sentencing Hearing set for 11/09/22 - not deliverable as addressed

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:41 PM Defendant Noah L Zachman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Noah L Zachman.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Initial Appearance set for 09/19/22 @ 1:45 p.m. in Br 2

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

1:29 PM Defendant Noah Lee Zachman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Maxwell Bergner appears on behalf of the defendant.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of Methamphetamine, Possession of Electronic Weapon and Bail Jumping.
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated. 

Attorney for the defendant does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

BY THE COURT: 
Court will adopt the $1,000 signature bond as requested by the State with conditions as stated on the record.
